channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: 報道業界が苦境に立たされるなか、権力者の責任を追及する大学ジャーナリストたちによる調査やその他の影響力のある仕事を見てみよう（David Bauder/Associated Press）。
item.description:
David Bauder / Associated Press:
A look at the investigations and other high-impact work by college journalists, who are holding people in power accountable even as the news industry struggles  —  Within the past year, young journalists have produced investigations that led to the resignation of Stanford University's president …

item.title: 生放送でウクライナ戦争を糾弾した後、欧州に逃亡したロシア人ジャーナリスト、マリーナ・オフシアニコワの毒殺の疑いでパリ警察が捜査している（AP通信）。
item.description:
Associated Press:
Paris police investigate the suspected poisoning of Marina Ovsyannikova, the Russian journalist who fled to Europe after denouncing the Ukraine war on live TV  —  French prosecutors are investigating a suspected poisoning Thursday of a Russian journalist who fled after denouncing the war in Ukraine on live TV.

item.title: デイリー・メールのソーシャル・ビデオ責任者フィル・ハーヴェイに、ニュース出版社のTikTok戦略についてインタビューした。
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
An interview with Daily Mail's head of social video Phil Harvey on the news publisher's TikTok strategy; the outlet's main TikTok account has 6.8M+ followers  —  Don't be surprised if you hear a member of Gen Z saying the Daily Mail “slays” on Tiktok or that it's gone “hard af” with its “fire edits”.

item.title: ザ・デビュー：ハイビのバン・シヒョク会長が、BTSの成功を模倣し、世界中の女性からなるグループを米国を拠点に結成するプロジェクト、ドリーム・アカデミー（Bloomberg）。
item.description:
Bloomberg:
A look at The Debut: Dream Academy, Hybe Chairman Bang Si-Hyuk's project to form a US-based group of women from around the world that replicates BTS' success  —  With the world's biggest boy band on hiatus, Bang Si-Hyuk wants to replicate the formula that changed music—but with even more global appeal.

item.title: SAG-AFTRAのストライキが長引くなか、数十万人のハリウッドの失業クルーが貯蓄を切り崩し、NPOの緊急資金に頼っている（ニューヨーク・タイムズ）。
item.description:
New York Times:
Hundreds of thousands of out-of-work Hollywood crew members have dipped into savings and turned to nonprofits' emergency funds as the SAG-AFTRA strike drags on  —  The lives of hundreds of thousands of crew members have been upended, and even a deal between the actors and the studios might not help much in the short term.

item.title: コムキャストがモルガン・スタンレーを、ディズニーがJPモルガン・チェースを雇い、Huluの評価を依頼。
item.description:
Alex Sherman / CNBC:
Comcast hires Morgan Stanley and Disney hires JPMorgan Chase to value Hulu, a step toward Disney buying Comcast's 33% stake; their 2019 deal set a $27.5B floor  —  - Comcast and Disney have hired investment banks to appraise Hulu.  — On Nov. 1, Comcast and Disney can both trigger an option …

item.title: カナダの一流新聞社を代表するニュース・メディア・カナダは、12月19日までに最終規則が施行される可能性のあるオンラインニュース法について、グーグルの問題点の多くを支持している（Ismail Shakil/Reuters）
item.description:
Ismail Shakil / Reuters:
News Media Canada, which represents Canada's top newspapers, backs many of Google's issues with the Online News Act, whose final rules could hit by December 19  —  A Canadian news industry body on Thursday lent support to some of Google's concerns about a new law that aims …

item.title: 60のボットを使って、4つのニュースメディアをシードした後のTikTokのレコメンデーションを調べたところ、レコメンデーションされた動画のうちニュース関連のものはわずか18％だった（Nieman Lab）。
item.description:
Nieman Lab:
A study using 60 bots to look at TikTok's recommendations after seeding with four news outlets finds that just 18% of the recommended videos were news-related  —  Plus: The “labor” of avoiding news, a study of disagreements between journalists and their bosses about objectivity, and the effects of Trump's criticisms of Fox News.

item.title: CBSニュースのウェンディ・マクマホン最高経営責任者（CEO）によると、同局はイスラエルとハマスの戦争に関する1,000本以上のビデオを精査したが、CBSが使用できるのはわずか10％で、多くの場合、誤った情報が原因だったという（Kate Marino/Axios
item.description:
Kate Marino / Axios:
CBS News CEO Wendy McMahon says the network has sifted through 1,000+ videos of the Israel-Hamas war and only 10% are usable by CBS, often due to misinformation  —  CBS News CEO Wendy McMahon says the network has sifted through over 1,000 videos of the war in Israel — and only 10% are usable.

item.title: 研究結果：米国では、非営利の報道機関が司法区に開設された後、公共汚職の訴追が増加し、その報道機関の資金が多いほど訴追の可能性が高くなる（Clark Merrefield/Nieman Lab）。
item.description:
Clark Merrefield / Nieman Lab:
Study: US prosecutions for public corruption rise after a nonprofit news outlet opens in a judicial district and are more likely the more funding the outlet has  —  “We find a really strong connection that they're able to maintain accountability in these communities.”

item.title: Netflixの共同CEOであるテッド・サランドスによると、SAG-AFTRAの交渉が決裂したのは、組合が「成功報酬型ボーナス」ではなく、ストリーミング配信の契約者一人一人への「賦課金」を望んだからだという（Caitlin Huston/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Caitlin Huston / The Hollywood Reporter:
Netflix co-CEO Ted Sarandos says SAG-AFTRA talks broke down because the union wanted a “levy” on each streaming subscriber instead of a “success-based bonus”  —  “A levy on top of our revenue or per subscriber, with no insight into the revenue per subscriber or anything …

item.title: アンテナ：YouTubeのNFL Sunday Ticketは、DirecTVの120万契約に対し、推定130万契約を集めた。
item.description:
Rob Golum / Bloomberg:
Antenna: YouTube's NFL Sunday Ticket attracted an estimated 1.3M signups, vs. 1.2M reportedly under DirecTV; ~41% of the NFL subscribers are new to YouTube TV  —  Die-hard fans of live sports are migrating online in big numbers, responding to the multibillion-dollar investments by major technology companies …

item.title: ザ・ブロックが元ニュース編集長兼マネージング・エディターのティム・コープランドを編集長に指名、コープランドはデクリプトを経て2021年にザ・ブロックに入社（Chris Roush/Talking Biz News）
item.description:
Chris Roush / Talking Biz News:
The Block names Tim Copeland, formerly its news editor and managing editor, as editor-in-chief; Copeland worked at Decrypt before joining The Block in 2021  —  Cryptocurrency news site The Block has named Tim Copeland to be its editor in chief.  —  He previously has been news editor and managing editor of the publication.

item.title: ネットフリックスは、ファンが服を買ったり、テーマに沿った料理を食べたり、ライブ体験をしたりできる常設店舗「ネットフリックス・ハウス」を、2025年に米国の2店舗からオープンする予定だ（Lucas Shaw/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Lucas Shaw / Bloomberg:
Netflix plans to open Netflix House, permanent stores where fans can buy clothes, eat themed food, and try live experiences, starting with two US venues in 2025  —  - Its first permanent retail sites will be named ‘Netflix House’  — Initial locations in US will be followed by global expansion

item.title: コミック作家とアーティストのグループがゴースト・マシーンを設立し、クリエイターたちが専属となり、共同で所有、運営、利益を得る（George Gene Gustines/New York Times）
item.description:
George Gene Gustines / New York Times:
A group of comic book writers and artists form Ghost Machine, a company the creators will be exclusive to, as well as jointly own, operate, and profit from  —  The founding writers and artists of Ghost Machine will be exclusive to the company and will jointly own, operate and profit from it.
